headline: US holiday package deliveries to rise 5% from 2024, ShipMatrix forecasts
summary: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) -U.S. delivery companies are on track to handle 2.3 billion packages this holiday season, 5% more than last year, as an extra shopping day helps offset the drag from President Donald Trump's tariff policies, according to a forecast released on Monday.  Investors are keen for information on the holiday delivery season that stretches from Thanksgiving to Christmas because companies like FedEx and UPS can deliver twice the normal number of packages on some days.  The expected increase in holiday deliveries will not be spread equally across companies, logistics technology provider ShipMatrix said on Monday.

headline: FedEx, UPS peak season surcharges could drive shippers to competitors
summary: Parcel carriers like FedEx and UPS are implementing peak season surcharges to recover costs when there isn’t a spike in volume to gear up for, leaving frustrated customers looking for alternative providers. The post FedEx, UPS peak season surcharges could drive shippers to competitors appeared first on FreightWaves.
